questions.question: I .......................... come if I have time.
questions.description: When the verb in the if-clause is in the simple present tense, we use will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: ....................................... you like some tea?
questions.description: We use would in polite offers.

questions.question: 'There is the doorbell.' 'I ............................. go.'
questions.description: Will is used to announce decisions that we make at the time of speaking.

questions.question: I didn't expect that I ........................................ fail the test.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we use would in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: If I knew that you were in trouble, I ....................................... help you.
questions.description: When the verb in the if clause is in the simple past tense, we use would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: I .................................. wake up early if there was a good reason to.
Do you think she .................................... come if you invited her?
I don't know whether I ..................................... have time tomorrow.
